required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre Randomized Controlled Clinical Study of the Efficacy of Carbon Nanoparticles Versus Indocyanine Green in Surgical Treatment of Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Both nano carbon and ICG as lymph node tracers in colorectal cancer have their own value, this study was to contrast two tracers in colorectal cancer surgeries, so as to find out the best lymphnode tracer in colorectal cancer, in order to further improve postoperative lymph node inspection, precise postoperative adjuvant therapy and improve the patients' long-term survival.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of positive lymph nodes detected at different T stages
the ratio of positive lymph nodes

intervention.description: injecting Carbon Nanoparticles Suspension for lymph node detection
Injecting indocyanine green for lymph node detection
